landing.title: Next Generation Frontend Tooling
landing.description: Get ready for a development environment that can finally catch up with you.

accordion.title: What is this starter template for?
accordion.content: This starter template is designed to help developers quickly set up a modern React project using Vite, Tailwind CSS, and other best practices. It provides a solid foundation with optimized configurations and useful tools.

accordion.title: What is the difference between the advanced and lightweight templates?
accordion.content: The advanced template includes TypeScript, Jotai for state management, react-i18next for internationalization, class-variance-authority for styling, and additional tools like ESLint, Prettier, and Husky. The lightweight template is simpler, using JavaScript and focusing on a minimal yet powerful setup.

accordion.title: Who should use this template?
accordion.content: This template is perfect for developers who want to build React applications efficiently. Whether you're a beginner looking for a structured starting point or an experienced developer needing a scalable setup, this template has you covered.

accordion.title: How do I get started with this template?
accordion.content: You can use the template by clicking 'Use this template' on GitHub to create a new repository. Then, clone the repository, install dependencies using `pnpm install`, and you're ready to start coding!

accordion.title: Can I customize this template?
accordion.content: Yes! You can modify the Tailwind configuration, update routing, add your own components, and extend it as needed. The template is built to be flexible and customizable.

accordion.title: Does this template support internationalization?
accordion.content: Yes! The advanced template includes built-in support for internationalization using react-i18next, making it easy to manage multiple languages in your project.

accordion.title: How is state management handled?
accordion.content: The advanced template uses Jotai, a minimal and flexible state management library, allowing for simple and scalable state handling.

accordion.title: Can I contribute to this project?
accordion.content: Absolutely! This project is open-source, and contributions are welcome. Feel free to submit issues, suggest improvements, or create pull requests on GitHub.

accordion.title: Is this template free to use?
accordion.content: Yes! This template is open-source and available under the MIT License, meaning you can use, modify, and distribute it freely.
